Class BuildingShip

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.PlayerStates.PlayerState
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.PlayerStates.BuildingShip
public class BuildingShip extends PlayerState
Represents the state in which a player is constructing a ship. This state allows specific commands related to ship building and provides behavior to manage the construction process.

    • allows

      public boolean allows(FinishBuildingCommand command)
      Determines whether the provided FinishBuildingCommand is allowed in the current player state. The method evaluates if the given command can be executed based on the rules and conditions of the current state.
      Overrides:
      allows in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      command - the FinishBuildingCommand to evaluate
      Returns:
      true if the command is permitted in this state, false otherwise

    • createDefaultCommand

      public Command createDefaultCommand(String gameId, Player player)
      Creates a default command for the BuildingShip state, representing the finishing of the ship construction process. This command prepares the player by completing the ship building, setting readiness, and marking them as having acted.
      Specified by:
      createDefaultCommand in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      player - the player for whom the default command is being created
      Returns:
      a Command instance that finalizes the ship building process for the player

    • shouldAct

      public void shouldAct(Player player)
      Resets the player's "has acted" status to false, indicating that the player can perform an action.
      Overrides:
      shouldAct in class PlayerState
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose "has acted" status is to be reset

    • toClientState

      public PhaseEvent toClientState()
      Converts the current state of this object into a client-compatible representation specifically for the "Building" phase of the game.
      Specified by:
      toClientState in class PlayerState
      Returns:
      a PhaseEvent object encapsulating a BuildingClient state, which represents the current phase-specific client state associated with the building phase of the game.
